description.text: Welcome to Vault Hunters Third Edition!

This modpack turns your Minecraft experience into a progression based Action RPG game. It is aimed to be played over a longer period of time and has many accessibility settings to customise your playthrough to suit your playstyle!
In this quest line we teach you about the basic fundamentals of the game and help you get started on your journey.

Before you start playing, make sure you set the game to a difficulty that suits you, this can be done in the pause menu, and we offer 5 different difficulties. These settings affects mobs health and damage inside vaults.

In addition to different difficulties, you can also select your gamemode. Vault Hunters features three game modes; Normal, Casual and Hardcore with Normal being the default gamemode. Your gamemode can be set using the /gamerule vaultMode.
- death after level twenty causes a spirit to spawn at your spawn point, using a spirit extractor you can buy back your lost items
- death after level twenty does not cause item loss, you just take some durability damage instead
- death after level twenty causes permanent loss of items and inventory
will invite friends to your party so you can vault together and see each others health.
will group players into a team so that they can work on their researches together.

Before you get in to your first vault, we want to inform you about a few important parts of Vault Hunters. Vault Hunters has an in-depth Ability and Talent system that you will utilise to make your Vault experience much more enjoyable. 

Abilities typically focus on giving you powerful active skills that significantly change how you play the game; ranging from damaging abilities like Nova or Rampage, healing abilities like Heal and Totem and survivability abilities such as Dash and Ghost Walk. 

Talents provide the player with passive buffs. There is a wide variety of Talents to check out, each built to level up specific aspects of your experience. 

Check out the Vault UI by pressing 'H' by default and click on the second and third tabs at the top to view Abilities and Talents respectively. 

Your reward for this quest is
, it's highly recommended to take the
if this is your first time playing as there is no natural health regeneration in the vaults

Sky Vaults is a sky block alternative to Vault Hunters that changes the core gameplay loop. The main resource gathering method revolves around running Raw Vaults and collecting resources from within the Vault rather than exploring and collecting them in the Overworld.

Budding Crystals will provide you with basic Raw Crystals that allow you to collect basic loot to help progress you towards a proper Vault Crystal!
Now that you have your very own Raw Crystal you can now right-click it onto your Vault Portal to open it and descend into the Vault.

There is a time limit within the Vault, requiring you to complete it before it ticks down to 0. Marking your way with blocks will allow you to easily find your way back to your portal. 

If you die you will return to the overworld and if you are under vault level 20 you will be granted 'Beginners Grace' which will allow you to keep all your loot regardless of dying or escaping.

If you manage to complete the Vault you will be granted a Crate that can be placed and then Sneak+Right-Clicked to open!
. It can be mined with an
and fortuned to increase your yield!
Make sure to mine a bit so you have enough for the early stages of your adventure.
The next step to your adventure is finding
. Vault Stone can be found inside of
without silk touch, there is a chance to get a
, make sure to not throw these away as they are used to make
itself is a very sturdy material used for many different things, but perhaps most importantly used to make your vault portals!

The chipped vault rocks you found are used to craft a Vault Rock, which is the base ingredient of any Vault Crystal, which in turn are used to open up vaults!

Craft a Vault Rock by combining 4 Chipped Vault rocks with 1 Chromatic Iron Ingot.

Tip: If you ever need recipe assistance, we recommend using the mod JEI to search recipes on the right hand side of your inventory
Now it's time to craft your Vault Altar, placing your vault rock on your Vault Altar is how you obtain your recipe for crafting a Vault Crystal

The time has come to forge your first Vault Crystal! Every recipe is different and the amount of required ingredients will slowly scale up as you craft more crystals.

Using a Vault Rock on a Vault Altar will identify the items required to complete the crystal recipe. You can submit items to the altar by throwing them out of your inventory near the altar. Once the altar recipe is finished, applying a redstone signal completes the crafting process.

If you struggle to tell what an item is you can crouch to view its name.

In Vault Hunters, Enchantments are a bit different than in Vanilla Minecraft. Protection and Offensive enchantments have been disabled, in order to allow higher scaling of defensive and offensive attributes down the line. There are however some enchantments that work both on vanilla tools and gear, as well as vault tools and gear.

The Vault Enchanter is your go to table for enchanting any gear or tools, it will always offer the max available enchantment for the cost of some emeralds and xp, craft one and try to put any enchantable item in it.
Vault potions are an out of combat alternative to the

.
They are the only type of potion that doesn't anger

inside the vaults!

Vault Potions have a set amount of

to be used each vault, completely refilling itself once you have exited a vault.
Starting out you have access to the

tier of potions, later in your adventure you will have the possibility to research better tiers, granting you bigger heals with each charge.
When crafting your first Potion (
) you get to make the choice between 3 different recharge mechanics;
, which recharges your vial when killing a certain amount of mobs
, which recharges your vial when looting a certain amount of chests

, which recharges your vial passively over time

Don't worry though, you can craft them all and see which fits you the best, but you can only ever use one per vault!

Using your completed Vault Crystal on your Portal will open a Vault that is quite different from the Raw Vaults you may be used to by this point. Notably, the loot is incredibly more diverse and useful so make sure to check every chest and start collecting everything you can.

Looting in vaults is fun, and there are a lot of exciting things to find!
Gear stats like
increases the amount of loot you find while
makes you find higher tier loot.
In addition to chests having loot, killing mobs will yield
, which can be used to purchase rare items in the

.
However, all of this loot can quickly become overwhelming, and any good hunter needs good loot organisation!
Shulker Boxes can go a long way in the beginning, and their shells can be found inside
is a much better and more reliable way to collect your loot.
The first pouch of your journey is on us, but we do recommend crafting more as you progress. Bigger pouches, belts and backpacks can later be researched for
Pouches can be upgraded with upgrade cards to make them carry more loot, automatically pick up loot when you break a chest, void excess loot and even feed you!

The pouch itself can also be configured with a filter, or left empty to fit any items.
To configure a filter, open your pouch and browse to the

tab allows you to set a filter for your pouch to either whitelist or blacklist certain content to go inside it. These filters can also be saved and reapplied to other pouches later on. We recommend you play around with these settings until you understand the system.
Completing this quest will reward you with two basic upgrades, which can both be installed in your pouch:
which will make the pouch automatically pick up items from the floor, when a chest is broken or items are thrown out of it

which can be configured to void (delete) any excess items that can't fit in your pouch. Voiding items may sound weird, but can be extremely useful to improve your early game looting. These are expensive to craft however, so use the one from this quest wisely!
, the items dropped from mobs, are better to store in a

. The Shard Pouch can only store Soul Shards, but an infinite amount of them as long as it is in your inventory. It can also be left in your inventory while purchasing things from the Black Market, without you having to manually count Soul Shards, it is a must have for any hunter!

Completing bounties is a great way to secure yourself some extra loot and give yourself a solid goal to work towards. You will first need to craft yourself a Bounty Table and then interact with it by right-clicking it.

Inside the Bounty Table you can select a bounty by clicking on one of the available bounties and clicking activate. Once you complete a bounty then you can go back to the table and collect your rewards.
The Tool Station can be used to craft tools that are able to significantly enhance your experience in the vaults. It can also be used to craft jewels that can be applied to your vault tool
Vault Tools are the successor to vanilla tools. These can be modified with jewels to apply new affinities and traits to the tool.
Affinities allow you to break chests/coins at a significantly faster speed enabling you to instantly mine all coins and chests apart from wooden ones.

There are also jewels that can change the tools functionality to include that of another. For example you could put a Shovelling jewel on a Pick to create a Mattock that can mine as fast as a pickaxe and dig as quick as a shovel!
There are also more modifiers that enhance your tool significantly:
both enhance your tool with higher loot capabilities.
has a chance to disarm a trapped chest inside the Vaults.
increases base mining speed of your tool!
adds a chance to double the output of a mined Vault Ore inside the vaults! Works with Silk Touch and Fortune.
increases the base Durability of the tool

both change the tool to have special interactions. Pulverizing acts as a basic Tool based replacement to pulverizing/crushing processing the output of the block that is mined. Smelting will smelt the output of the block that is mined!
can be applied to Hammers to increase their mining AOE
makes a tool stay in your inventory even through death!
applies a chance for your tool to not take durability outside of vaults. At 100% it will make your tool unbreakable!
increases the range at which the player can interact with blocks.
The Jewel Applicator makes applying jewels to you tools as simple as ever by providing you with the means of easily seeing the outcome of your Tool.

The Jewel Applicator has three parts of its inventory; 
The

is where you can put your jewels, showing you the total outcome of if they were placed on your tool. 
The

is where you place your tool and can also see the visual output of combining tool type jewels like shovelling or axing for example. 
Lastly, the
will show you the updated stats using the jewels placed on the left side, automatically calculating capacity and all your prefixes and suffixes as you place jewels into the Applicator
and this decides how much of the
of your Tool will be used up.

Expertises are gained by spending Expertise Points which are obtained every 5 levels. Expertises are similar to Talents providing passive buffs to the player, however these are targeted towards more specific use cases such as Fortunate which can add two additional Fortune levels to the player or Angel which allows you to craft an Angel Block which provides creative flight in a 64 block radius around it.

There are a total of twenty expertise points to be acquired through your playthrough and due to their utility they are not as easy to reset, requiring a Neuralizer rather than a regret orb.

The Vault Forge is used to craft gear and weapons as well as powerful trinkets once they have been unlocked. Crafting gear increases proficiency further honing your skills at forging specific types of gear.

Magnets suck up loot within a radius of the player! They synergise exceptionally with Affinities/Breaking chests within the vault and can speed up your looting significantly. Magnets also have modifiers that can be applied to enhance their strengths.

To equip a Magnet, press the Curios button that is next to your helmet slot within your inventory and place the magnet in the Belt slot!
Forge a Magnet in the Vault Forge

The Artisan Station can be used to further modify and create gear that is suited towards a certain build style. The interface has slots for Vault Plating, Vault Bronze, A wide variety of differently functioning focuses and your Vault Gear.

Placing Vault Bronze, Vault Plating and a Wild Focus into the Artisan Station will allow you to reroll all of your gear's modifiers. Clicking the Reforge button will apply new modifiers onto your gear/weapon. This is the starting steps to creating gear fit for your build style.
Reroll a Gear Piece with a Wild Focus
The Vault Recycler is used to break down old and unwanted gear into Vault Scrap, Wild Focuses and Faceted Focuses. It can also be used to break down and recycle Jewels, Magnets and Inscriptions!
is a very useful table. It allows you to modify your

to your charges!

Some of these
have to be unlocked, which you will learn about later, but a handful are

already now. 
One effect can be added per potion, and their strength

Crafting and consuming Burgers is a great way to gain additional Vault Experience. Burgers are crafted by combining burger ingredients in a Crafting Table. These progression based ingredients can be found within Living Chests and grant the player more experience based on the amount of ingredients used!

As you level up, the Vault will adapt and present you with new, more challenging Objectives; these can also be added to your crystal by crafting a Seal and applying it to your crystal in an anvil. 

Level 10 marks the introduction of the Elixir Objective to random vaults.
Level 20 marks the introduction of the Scavenger Objective to random vaults.
Level 50 marks the introduction of the Hunt The Guardians Objective to random vaults.

Combining a Vault Crystal and a Seal in an anvil will set the objective on the crystal to that of the Seals, allowing you more control over the type of Objective you are presented. 

Elixir Vaults function by tasking the player with collecting and submitting an amount of Elixir and awarding the player elixir for each action carried out within the Vault. The Elixir amounts awarded for each action can change every Vault so you may want to note what action awards the most Elixir, visible by the increase of size/quantity of the Elixir orbs.

Once you have filled your Elixir bar you will need to find and fill a Lodestone to complete the Vault. 

In Co-Op instead of completing the Vault you will then be able to collect Elixir for your friends to help them complete their objective. The Vault completes when all remaining Vaulters have successfully filled their Lodestones!
Apply a Seal of the Sage to a Vault Crystal

It can be rather stressful to make decisions when it comes to which abilities and what talents to take throughout your playthrough, but, don't stress!

Vault Hunters have a mechanic for regretting your decisions using
. Consuming a Regret Orb will give you an unspent regret point, which can be used to unlearn talents or abilities.
To craft a Regret Orb you need
. Fully completed Regret Orbs can also be obtained through

Jewels may not always have the perfect size to be utilised to their maximum potential, which is where the Jewel Cutting Station comes into play!

The Cutting Station takes Silver Scrap and Vault Bronze and gives the player a 50% chance to cut down the size of a jewel randomly between 1 and 10 size. If the cut fails, the jewel will be lowered by one tier' Perfect become Flawless, Flawless become Flawed, Flawed become Chipped and lastly if a Chipped jewel cut fails, the jewel will break and provide the player with a Gemstone and a small amount of Wutodie.

You may also spec into the Jeweler Expertise which provides the player with up to 3 free cuts without removing an affix!

With the black market you can use soul shards to purchase from a pool of items that refresh every 2 hours or from a random pool of all the items that can be obtained via purchasing. There are a variety of rare items that you roll in the Black Market so make sure to check in often!

The Soul Diffuser breaks down vault items into soul dust which can then be turned into Soul Shards to be used as a currency for the Black Market. This gives you the choice of deciding what you deem valuable and what you deem worthy of diffusing!
The Identification Stand is a block that when right clicked on will
all unidentified vault gear in your inventory instantly.

Obtaining and using Knowledge Stars is one of the key aspects to the Vault Hunters progression as it is the key component to unlocking new mods. Pressing the 'H' Key and selecting the Researches tab at the top will show you all the stuff you can unlock. Note that purchasing some of these will increase the price of subsequent unlocks within that group of unlocks.

Your reward for this quest is a Mod Box! When used, the Mod Box awards a random item from your unlocked mods
Reaching level 20 marks the end of the tutorial stage of Vault Hunters!
dying in a vault no longer keeps your items, you will learn more about that in the
A lot of new things happen at this level, you will now find
inside the vault, as well as additional loot and new mobs!
Don't worry though, you've only just begun!
The goal for any hunter is to complete the infamous Artifact Puzzle, and to fight the legendary Herald!
, after level 20. The chance of finding an Artifact gets higher the higher level your vault is when you complete it.
There are 25 unique artifacts to collect, and in order to gain access to
you need to collect all of them!
will display the puzzle above it, and artifacts can be placed in their correct spot to complete the puzzle.
While hunting for Artifacts you will most likely come across duplicates. These can be
in order to burn in to a
which can be used to craft a new Artifact.

The Spirit Extractor is used to recover loot lost within vaults. If you die, pick up your spirit by Sneak+Right-Clicking it and place it onto the Extractor by Right-Clicking it. This will give you a price in Vault Gold that you will have to pay in order to recieve your items.

Another big change after level 20 is the ability to find Trinkets!
These are powerful items that can be equipped in your bauble slots. They come in two different colours,
. You may equip one of each colour at any given time for a total of two trinkets.
trinkets give you a feature that can't be acquired elsewhere, for example the ability to

Trinkets don't have durability, instead they have uses, or charges. They can be permanently used outside vaults without any cost, but they will use up one charge every time you enter a vault with one equipped. They can also not be unequipped inside a vault.
There is an
which gives you a random chance to not use a trinket charge when entering a vault.
Once you have found a trinket, it will be permanently discovered and can be crafted in the

.
A Crafted Trinket will always have 12 uses/charges, while a looted trinket randomly rolls 20 to 30 uses/charges.
Your first trinket is a reward of reading this quest, hopefully you get something you will like! If you don't, trinkets can be scrapped in the Vault Recycler, which yields their main ingredient:

.
The chance to get a Trinket Scrap is determined by how many uses/charges the trinket have left when being scrapped; A fully charged trinket will always yield the scrap, while a completely depleted one will never yield the scrap.
Dungeons are scary places inside the vault, containing a challenge and loot!
Dungeon Doors, found randomly inside the vault are opened by
them. Once opened, the dungeon will announce what

.

The mob head on the door itself tells you what type of mobs are guarding the dungeon.
, the larger the dungeon, the more loot and the higher the chance for an
, making it so that the dungeon monsters can't exit the dungeon, but don't worry you can walk through this

.
Tread carefully, and respect the difficulty! Good luck hunter!
After level 20, while not playing on

, dying in a vault means that you either lose gold by buying back your spirit, or lose items if you don't buy back your spirit.

This can sometimes be both scary and frustrating; however, if you ever find yourself in a situation where you would like to gain insurance from death before entering a vault, you can check out the

.

This item, when combined with an unmodified vault crystal, will let you keep your inventory if you would die. It does so, while
in the vault, which can be positive in case you ever need to catch up!

As you level up the vaults get more difficult, as everything inside a vault scales.

This can sometimes lead to you falling behind with your gear progression, which can make the vaults more difficult.

If you find yourself in this situation you can use a
! This pearl can be combined with a Vault Crystal in an anvil to make the vault in to a
increase the amount of loot & vault ores
Apply a Plunderer's Pearl to a Vault Crystal
Deep inside the dungeons you may find an

! The bigger the dungeon, the more likely you are to find one.

There are two types of archives, the

.

These contain the ancient wisdom of
! When interacted with they will teach you a new modifier for either
and will allow you to modify your
or gear with more control and options!

The Modifier Workbench allows you to craft guaranteed modifiers onto your gear giving you a large amount of control in terms of creating specific builds. Some modifiers unlock via leveling, however there are others that can only be unlocked by finding a Modifier Archive within dungeons!

The Wardrobe allows you to store a set of gear and a hotbar that you can quick switch between using the GUI. This enables having many different build sets to play with while allowing for much greater ease of access.

Just like the Wardrobe allows for storing gear, the Skill Altar allows for storing Abilities and Talents so that you can quick switch between different builds! This synergises exceptionally well with the Wardrobe.
The Transmogrification Table allows you to transmog gear pieces to any unlocked transmog you have acquired. Place a gear piece and some bronze to begin viewing transmogs!
Catalysts are an important part of Vault Hunters. They allow you to
, increasing the amount of a specific chest, adding new ones, increasing the time and/or adding other bonuses to your run.

in unmodified vaults.

The Catalyst needs to be infused in a
. Once infused the Catalyst can be applied to a crystal using an anvil.
When you modify a crystal using catalysts it will get
, the more it gets, the more likely it is to get either
, which makes it so that the crystal does not accept more catalysts, or
, which makes the vault more difficult by either debuffing you, or adding obsticles inside the vault!
Apply an Infused Catalyst to a Vault Crystal in an Anvil

An Architect Vault is another way to customise your Vault. It allows you to build a vault with specific rooms!

To create your first Architect vault, start by crafting an
and apply it to a crystal in an Anvil.
Apply a Seal of the Architect to a Vault Crystal
On its own, a crystal with an Architect Seal is rather useless. In order to add rooms to it you need to add
. These can be crafted in the
and are also found rarely in

.

Inscriptions comes with or without a room, but always three affixes;

In order for the Vault to be fully built, and have all blocks (and loot) that it is supposed to have, you need to reach 100% completion. You can still run a vault without 100% completion, but blocks and chests may be replaced with bedrock!
By default an Architect Vault only gets you 10 seconds, any time from this affix will be added up to that time for your total Vault time.
The same metric caused by adding Catalysts to a crystal, the more you get, the more likely the crystal is to become either

.

An inscription without a room is useful because of its affixes, while a room inscription adds the room itself, in addition to the affixes.
When building an Architect Vault your goal is to balance these affixes; not all inscriptions are great!
Since Blank Inscriptions doesn't add any room, make sure you add at least one room inscription of your choice before entering the vault!
Finally, as long as a crystal hasn't become unmodifiable, you can add catalysts on top of your inscriptions to further enhance how the room plays out!
Apply an Inscription to an Architect Crystal
By reaching level 40 you have made the Vault Gods aware of you!
The Gods are neither good nor bad, and you can make the choice to fully ignore them. However, they might prove worthy of your time!
It is time you get familiar with the Vault Gods!
Neither good nor bad, they are;

. They can not be crafted.

Charms is your way to show your affinity to a specific god while inside a vault
. They can be identified by rolling them like gear, and there are four different tiers of charms;

The higher the tier, the more affinity they can have to their god.

Charms have uses, and can not be unequipped or equipped during a vault. A use charge is consumed every time you interact with a God Altar inside a vault.
Affinity is important to understand for your next quest, so, here is your first charm, identify it, and wear it proudly!
God Altars will start to appear in vaults after level 40.
The Altars represent one of the four gods.
Interacting with one of these altars inside the vault will give you a challenge by the god. Completing the task will give you a
, strongly buffing you in the vault and if you are lucky enough, and show enough affinity to the god, you can also gain a
with that God. But, beware! Failing the challenge will

!

Note, you can only reach 25 reptuation points in total, after that point you will lose reputation with another god, when gaining a new one.
Now that you know a bit about the gods and understand their altars, it's time to let you know about the
is a vault designed completely by you! It can be revisited once every day, and can be

to fully suit your needs.

In order to get started, you will need a
and apply it to a crystal, this will grant you access to the
of the Divine Paradox, letting you buy rooms for
Each room is associated with a god, and will require you to have the sufficient
with that god to build. Every time you add a room of any god, the

from that god goes up.

The
of the Divine Paradox is empty in terms of loot and mobs, it exists solely for you to design and extend it, you can enter it any time you can craft a crystal and seal it with the
. So, let's start there, craft a
, attach it to a crystal and explore the world of divinity!
Attach a Seal of the Creator to a Crystal

Once you have built a few rooms in your Divine Paradox, it's time to run the vault!

You can do this only once every

, and since the Divine Paradox is a personal vault, you can not bring your friends.

The Divine Paradox starts out with
on the timer, as opposed to the 25 minutes of a regular vault.

can increase the time.

The goal of running your Divine Paradox is to collect

from each god, they appear in chests, coin piles and ores in a room blessed by the corresponding god. Collect the required amount and return to your start room to sacrifice them to the correct god to complete the Divine Paradox!
This will be difficult in the beginning, as you may not have enough rooms of each god to complete the vault, however, as you extend your Divine Paradox it becomes easier and easier to complete, and completing it is good, because the gods will always bless you with an

!

Once you have built a few rooms in the build realm of the Divine Paradox, craft a
and attach it to a crystal in order to gain access to running the Divine Paradox!
Attach a Seal of the Ordinator to a Crystal
If you ever feel like you want to

of your Divine Paradox, and start over, you can!

You will need a

. These are extremely expensive, and when combined with a crystal sealed with the Seal of the Ordinator, in an anvil, it will completely nullify your progress, this action can not be undone, so use with great care!

We will give you a Paradoxical Gem, but be careful when, or if, you use it at all!

Reaching Vault Level 50 marks the halfway point in terms of levels, this means that you currently have half of your total expertise points already. The Neuralizer allows you to completely reset your currently specced expertise points in case you change your mind and decide that another expertise may suit your needs better!
After level 50, strange colourful doors will start appearing in the vaults, these are

!

They can be opened using a

of the same gem type that the door is made out of.
These keys are expensive and requires

as well as echo gems, but can be very worth it to make!

You start by making a
which you then combine with any legendary gem

Once you have a treasure key completed, bring it with you in to the vaults and search for a corresponding door, use the key on the door to open it.

Treasure Rooms contain a random amount of

!

The loot inside is random, but also the only place to find certain items!
Are you ready for your ascension?
After level 65 you are able to play around with and use
is a risk & reward challenge that can be applied to your Vault Crystal, just like a

. The Crystal has to be at least level 65 and have no other modification done to it.
When applied, you add

to your crystal!

If you complete the vault, you will get your

increases the amount of chests, ores, and coins that spawn inside the vault, and also increases the rarity of items, as well as giving you extra XP.
You can stack
indefinitely, but if you don't complete the vault, you will lose all your progression on your

and begin again from 0 stacks.

This is not a mandatory part of the game, but should you choose to participate, we wish you good luck!
Apply a Soul Flame to a Vault Crystal
You have completed all current available quests in Vault Hunters! More may be added in the future, so keep checking back here whenever you update your game!

Remember though, this questline is only the beginning, the overall goal of the game is to collect 25 unique artifacts, found very rarely in completion crates, as well as reaching level 100 and experiencing all the in-depth systems the game has to offer!
